author: Aditya Vaidya
text: "Used to really love this place
column5: getting delivery at least once every week or two. Unfortunately
column6: our last couple of orders have been well below par (one bland
column7: one inedible order).\n\nThe latest order of 2 Kati rolls (delivery) appeared to have stuffing which had gone completely bitter (it was either burnt
column8: or had something else wrong with the spices and peppers).\n\nHad to completely dump both rolls because they were unfortunately inedible. It's the first time I've dumped a complete order this size ever."

author: Divy Patel
text: 'Awesome food'

author: alka singh
text: 'We had ordered vada paw which was really very good I didn’t expect it to be that good.\nSo all together it was a good experience and looking forward to explore more menus'

author: Chris Castille
text: 'Had the lamb kima bowl and death by Tikka masala ....!!!!! The best!'

author: ann ricchio
text: "Great Indian fusion and convenient location. We've been back many times!"

author: Chris Putignano
text: 'This was my first time trying Indian food and I went all out. It was so delicious! The Tikka Masala burrito is a MUST!'

author: Emmanuel Delgado
text: 'Food was delicious and came very quickly'

author: mitali bonde
text: 'So yummy! food was delicious. Everything was tasty and well prepared with incredible flavors.\nLove love love their vadapav its very close to what we get in India
column5: I’m hooked. We also ordered the Naughty Naan with stuffed Paneer makhini. Great service too.'

author: Matt Tragna
text: "Omg this place is so good! The only thing I would critique is the little tiny squares of naan are silly (and not enough) give us big bread please we aren't children!  Also
column5: can you PLEASE sell t-shirts? It's a no-brainer to have customers advertise for your business!      YUM I want some now! <3"

author: omeer rahman
text: 'This is for that God awful commercial I had to suffer through during IPL matches.'

author: Anna M
text: 'Great food
column5: great service. GF options labeled on menu and took precautions to limit cross contamination.  Will definitely be back!'

author: X L
text: 'This is a typical “contemporary Indian” place
column5: but in a good way. Food is great
column6: music is kinda loud but all great songs. The only thing I didn’t really like was bun samosa
column7: which is tasty but literally 2 samosa in a bun

author: poonam Kapoor popli
text: 'Temptating Indian street type food.'

author: Dan
text: 'I have gone to this place but in Cali for years
column5: very excited one opened up in Hoboken!'

author: Faizan Cheema
text: 'Over priced for the portion size and taste. There was no air conditioning inside on warm day. We had to wait outside we were sweating badly standing inside. Im not how will food survive in that environment. I feel bad for the employees working in there.'

author: Majid Iqbal Pirzada
text: 'Fully cultured.'

author: D. Bansal
text: 'Vadav pav is so good'

author: Hsin Yi Wei
text: "We were craving for indian food
column5: but only for a quick lunch fix since we planned to have a feast for dinner. Curry Up Now popped up when we were searching
column6:
and what appealed us was their signature street food.

The option on the menu is not various and we had their Holy Molt Fried Ravioli & Death By Tikka Masala Thaili to share between 2 of us. The food was overall decent with proper portion and our favorite was the fried ravioli because the filling is creamy & cheesy with crunchy layer & appetizing sauce.

However
column7: we had a small complaint that they didn't serve water even tap water
column8: so we just purchased their limited bottle water selection."

author: Sanghamitra Sahoo
text: 'Naughty Naan was really good!'

author: Gabriela Llerena
text: 'Great costumer service! Good food!'

author: Nicholas Tancredi
text: 'First time trying this spot. Excellent food and very tasty. The atmosphere is very nice and the place is very clean. I had a burrito and an "Thums up" soda which is an equivalent of coca cola. I will definitely come back again when I am in the area!'

author: Karan Amin
text: 'One of the good place to eat in Hoboken! From street food to fusion food its all top notch.'

author: AB
text: 'Service was slow.\nThe potato in the Chaat was under-cooked.'

author: Suvedita Kushwah
text: 'Horrible food..... Food quality was worse... Salad had fungus
column5: daal lentil was too salty
column6: papdi Chaat was nowhere close to papdi Chaat. Overall food was not good. Ruined my birthday party'

author: Pranav Sawant
text: 'Amazing!'

author: Kristian Kotsbak
text: "Great food and service! We came during busy lunch time
column5: and we had a great experience. All the food came out quick
column6: and all of the dishes we ordered were incredibly tasty! Make sure to finish your meal with a mango lassi.  We'll be back for sure!"

author: Vivek Narayanan
text: 'Food is great
column5: Sue and her service is even better. Great addition to Washington St.\n\nTheir kathi roll and deconstructed samosas are to die for!'

author: Srishti Jain
text: "I haven’t had more terrible Indian food in life. It’s all frozen
column5: or ready to eat stuff. With even worse service
column6: and management that we had to cancel most of our orders. Do yourself a favor and don't fall for their cute menu."

author: viren patel
text: "This place is pathetic. I placed order for 3 items and waited for half an hour expecting they would atleast make the order. After waiting that long they said everything was out of stock. We could not serve you
column5: and said sorry for making us wait. Never bothered even to inform that they were running out of food so you shouldn't wait.  Overall service worst ever in my life."

author: Diksha Bhyana
text: 'The food was amazing! Their Nan pizza (Naughty Nan) is a must try. Additionally my order was prepared very quickly. I was a bit disappointed by the Mango Lassi and the palak Panner in my bowl though. However
column5: overall experience was great! The cashier did a commendable job being from a diverse background (not Indian origin)
column6: he was able to figure out requirements of the customers efficiency.'

author: Sam Crowson
text:
'I ordered the lamb keema bowl.

The lamb was perfectly seasoned and the chickpea dish is absolutely heavenly.  Everything was so incredibly delicious and the portion sizes were quite generous.

Another thing that made my experience even better was the service. The manager (“Sue” is what I remember her saying) was really nice and the two other workers were happy to socialize with me and the other customers that came in.

Great food
column5: great environment.'

author: Shivani Dedhia
text: 'Sue was absolutely amazinng! We loved this location 😍'

author: Dylan Wyka
text: "I stumbled upon Curry Up Now while exploring Washington St. after my train was cancelled. The manager
column5: Sue
column6: was extremely welcoming and but also even more informative and accommodating. All around a phenomenal experience with delicious food that has all the classic Punjabi flavours you'd expect from an Indian spot with an interesting modern and not-so-Indian preparation. I tried the Kathi Roll at Sue's suggestion and was very much pleased with the dish. P.S. Those chips? To die for! And as a spice enthusiast
column7: I was surprised that their spicy sauce actually prompted a tiny tear. Please support businesses like this
column8: especially amidst an already crippled economy!"

author: Kshitij Nagpal
text: 'Great food
column5: great customer service! I’ve tried samosas pretty much everywhere in the JC area but the samosas here are by far the best.'

author: Raj C
text: 'Excellent food and customer service.\nBig thanks to Damian for all his help and the suggestions as we were there for first time.'

author: Manpreet Dabb
text: "I order pani puri and chat papdi both were bad All puris are broken they give white Channa for filling that didn't taste well with pani puri. Pani was so sour that I didn't able to eat more than 2 puris. Taste was very bad and the lady at service ate while serving."

author: Kayla Ramlall
text: 'The first time we ordered delivery the food was great. The second time we picked up in store we were given less amount of food than the first time. The third time we ordered delivery
column5: the chicken in the tikka masala and the paneer in the paneer masala was very little again. Also the chana tasted different from the first two times. It tasted stale or maybe it wasn’t seasoned the same way as the first two times? This was very disappointing as I was very excited for a curry up location nearby.'

author: Charlie
text: 'Really good fast casual Indian food.  Plenty of meat and vegetarian options.  I got the chicken tikka masala bowl and it comes with chana masala. Curry-ous to see how  their spicy dishes are so will try that next time.  Mango lassi is a must.'

author: pooja mv
text: 'Food seemed pre-made... expected for a chain.Taste was okay. Ambience and service is good.'

author: Matthew McKeon
text: 'Food is delicious here! The price is right and customer service is great!'

author: Quincy Quince
text: 'Would I eat again? UMMM YEAH! The food and staff are lovely'

author: Dominique Bession
text: 'Authentic Indian food
column5: unusual dishes
column6: casual atmosphere.'

author: Aana S
text: 'Awesome samosas and vada pav. Wonderful customer service as well.'

author: habib ahmad
text: 'Definitely worth it!'

author: Ashima Handa
text: 'The paneer thaali and samosa deconstructed were delicious.'

author: Alex Wawroski
text: 'I had a great time here. Everyone was friendly and helpful
column5: the food was flavorful
column6: it was easy to find vegan options
column7: and I had a peaceful time eating in.'

author: Rashid Noorani
text: 'Beautiful place. Nice
column5: clean
column6: lot of activities and games to play near by.'

author: Sahil Bassi
text: 'Average taste.'

author: Chanikya vijay kumar
text: 'Manager sue was so amazing. She was really helpful and kind. She explained us the menu and gave us some sample food. I think overall the restaurant is really good.'

author: Alec Bowers
text: 'Amazing place to eat. Sue was amazing and was delicious food. I will definetely come again. If your in Hoboken top place to visit 😁😄😄'

author: NJ TECH
text: 'If you like well seasoned food and an amazing atmosphere
column5: this is the place for you. The marina is close by & the area has downtown Manhattan vibes. I got the chicken tikka bowl( very flavorful-with the right amount of spice for my sensitive palate) & Nan bites. AMAZING!!!!\nMy only regret was not buying an extra one because my mouth watered for more the next day and I don’t live in the area.'

author: Erica Lee Mitti
text: 'A very nice atmosphere nice workers. Music is good but the food is better. Highly recommend!!!'

author: Pratik Gaitonde
text: 'The Tikka masala plate is a must try.. for non-veg eaters the chicken Tikka masala is one the better I have ever had so make sure to take both portions of chicken.. (you can choose from either paneer or chicken). The dal was okayish though. Overall a wonderful meal.'

author: Sindhu Venugopal
text: 'Good food and the manager guy is amazing. Liked the dine out :) Thank You manager for the water bottle :D lol'

author: Rachit Arora
text: "Food quality good but pricey. I ordered a Tikka bowl from Uber Eats and it was a small box with garbanzo and Tikka masala with rice. No salad provided. All for $17 does not include Uber fees. Is the food tasty? Yes. Worth the money? Don't think so😅"

author: Stefan Haar
text: 'Great service by Damien and Sue! Decent Indian take out! Plenty to eat! Check it out!'

author: Des KF
text: "I love Indian food so was looking forward to trying this place. When I arrived I parked on the street nearby luckily because it was a busy Saturday. When I walked in I seen there was indoor and outdoor seating. The place was uniquely decorated. The lady asked if she could help me and I ordered the chicken tikka masala burrito. I never had it burrito style so I was looking forward to trying it this way. I waited about 10 minutes for the food
column5: thanked the lady and left. When I got home I dug in and it wasn't bad at all. It had a little kick which I liked. I definitely will come back to try more."

author: Vincent Patrick Rosa
text: 'AMAZING FOOD! The vegan plant protien made in house is fantastic! The Sexy Fries made vegan are just a wonderful blend of so many flavors that just works! And the cauliflower rice? Its hard to make cauliflower rice work and these guys made it work 110%!!! Thank you again
column5: Damien and everyone at Curry Up Now!'

author: Mouli Patel
text: 'The food is delicious and the service is great :) If you’re craving Indian street food this place will hit the spot!!'

author: William Smith
text: 'I enjoyed the food. This is a nice establishment.'

author: Mansi Chaki
text: 'Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent food. A must visit in Hoboken.'

author: Amit Rawat
text: 'Delicious food with excellent service. Didn’t expect this good Indian food in the downtown area. Most of the Indian restaurants I tried in city area have been a big disappointment but good to see there are few like ‘Curry up Now’ who are serving great tasting food at affordable price. Highly recommended!! We tried Bun Samosa
column5: American Punjabi thali and a kids platter with chicken burrito. Freshly fried potato chips served as sides added to the satisfaction. Keep it up ‘Curry up now’ !!'

author: Josh Pesin
text: "I came across this place quite by accident while walking through Hoboken
column5: NJ.  I was actually looking for a coffee place
column6: but being that I love Indian food
column7: plus the catchy name of this place made me pause and take a look inside.  This place bases its menu on Indian street food.  I noticed that they had a menu with burritos filled with traditional Indian ingredients.  They also had quesadillas stuffed with Indian food as well.  This excited me since I love both Indian AND Mexican food.  I ordered The Hungry Planet burrito and asked for it to be extra spicy.  Since I'm mostly vegetarian
column8: this dish included vegan plant protein and was perfect for my preferences.  I was offered the option of riced cauliflower instead of actual rice and I opted for the riced cauliflower (I need to cut my carbs).  The burrito was very flavorful and spicy.  I wolfed it down in no time flat.  I also tried the Deconstructed Samosa Burrito shared with me by my ex-girlfriend Jacky.  They put crushed samosa pieces in it which made it crunchy.  I was in heaven with each bite.  I spoke to one of the workers and he told me that is a California-based company and that Hoboken was their first East Coast location. I hope that one day they open one in Brooklyn

author: Bert Zhu
text: 'Awesome food'

author: Orwin Herod
text: 'First time here in the area and stumbled upon this eatery
column5: out of curiosity and being from the Caribbean we entered and was enticed by the smell of Curry......long story short we bought sat and ate and left as very satisfied customer. Go support anytime you are in this area. Friendly staff and GREAT Service.'

author: Avinash Melkote
text: 'I ordered masala chai from Curry Up Now and they went the extra mile to make it fresh just for me. Some of the best masala chai I have ever had! I look forward to trying some of the other items on their menu the next time I am in the area.'

author: Sandeep Bhatt
text: 'Good innovative chaats! Staff is great and super friendly.'

author: viraj soni
text: 'food was amazing! Me and my wife ended up ordering kachori chaat and naughty naan everything turned out to be great!\n\nThe service was great as well
column5: very friendly and welcoming staff.\n\nhighly recommend this place
column6: amazing Indian food!'

author: leslie moore
text: 'The bomb.com is all I have to say! It wasn’t overly spicy!! Everything went well together! I’m satisfied. :)'

author: Pratik Bhat
text: 'Ordered Bhel puri and Papdi Chaat. Found the taste ok and portions were small. Essentially over hyped Indian street food for American tastebuds. Wouldn’t recommend if you’re looking for authentic Indian chaat'

author: Huan Yan
text: "The food is great but the service is terrible. I waited over 20 minutes for a simple takeout order because they were prioritizing online pickup and delivery orders over in-person takeout orders which I only found out after I confronted them about this. Myself and three other people in the store were waiting for in-person pickup orders that typically take 2-3 minutes to fill and they couldn't adequately explain why they were doing this. If you find yourself in this situation make sure they aren't doing this to you.  Again
column5: great food
column6: terrible service."

author: Lifeis Good
text: 'The naughty naan naan was just delicious and mango lassi with it was phenomenal. Can wait to try on more things here.'

author: Paulo. A Gauna. G
text: 'Amazing place
column5: attention very good
column6: the food was amazing !!! More that expected'

author: Aashutosh Vijayant
text: "They didn't have much food available. Loud music made it impossible to hear or understand the person behind the counter. There was a lot of confusion about whether dine in option was available or not. Not happy"

author: Genesis Lopez
text: 'Wow! Such a great place to visit in Hoboken! Staff and owner are super friendly and attentive! food is amazing and a nice twist on traditional Indian cuisine plus it’s super easy to order online or through their app! 10/10 recommend!! Love it here and will be coming back regularly'

author: J&N barrera
text:
'(Translated by Google) super rich we are Chilean tourists and we were surprised 🇺🇸🇨🇱

(Original)
súper rico somos turistas chilenos y quedamos sorprendidos 🇺🇸🇨🇱'

author: Tarell Glenn
text: "Ok so I work across the street from  this spot and I must say... this restaurant is a hidden gem! I often have to go out to Edison or visit my Bangladesh friends for some amazing curries and trade recipes with them
column5: but now all I have to do is cross the street! The spices aren't spicy at all
column6: for the more conservative tongue and the flavors you get just can't be matched! I'm so glad I got to visit this fabulous favela of flavor! They will see me again. I hope you try them too."

author: Preetham MS
text: "Without adding any exaggeration it's one of the worst burrito I have ever had."

author: rashi
text: 'Too pricey and lacks taste!!!'

author: chris Cioce
text: 'AMAZING FOOD! AMAZING SERVICE!'

author: kovit nisar
text:
'Ravioli curry is good. Good ambience.

Paneer tikka burrito and saag paneer are not so great.

May be not mix chole is both these burrito'

author: Priyank. A
text: 'Got the thali over here. It had three curries and all tasted the same. Only the protein was different. Pretty average food.'

author: nihar kumthekar
text: 'Awesome place for a warm and delicious vada pav. The dry chutney and other condiments are very authentic. Definitely coming back here.'

author: Anuja Shah
text: "Naughty naan was all scrunched up into a box. It was burnt. The guy who took the order didn't know what well done was and he didn't know what pasteurized was. The bowl was served in a box. By the time we ate it was all mushy n soggy with cardboard."

author: gc
text: 'Highly recommend!! excellent customer service
column5: great portions for the price
column6: amazing flavors!! a great new go-to spot in hoboken'

author: Andrew Flores
text: 'excellent customer service
column5: friendly
column6: helpful
column7: knowledgeable. very flavorful and hearty portions. highly recommend!!'

author: Jose Duran
text: 'One of the best places to eat. Good music. Good managers. Good employes. 10/10 The lamb meat so good and juice'

author: Raquelle N.
text: 'Yummy delicious food in Hoboken! The smell from outside brought us in super hungry. I loved the warm breads with chicken and lamb options. The HUGE “Baseball” size samosas were incredibly delicious and super filling. The staff was so helpful in helping decide what dish to order and we had the pleasure of meeting the GM
column5: Safwad who was extremely kind and appreciative of meeting us. “Curry up Now” Indian Food is definitely a “Gem” on the block.'

author: aalamo12
text: 'I ordered a good part of the menu for my wife and I and we’re hooked after our first time! It’s so hard to find good and authentic Indian food. We smelled from the outside while passing their location. I used to drive a yellow cab in NYC and would eat at certain places. This place And their friendly manager Safwad is the real deal! Do yourself a favor and enjoy a great Indian meal at Curry up in Hoboken.\n\nAlberto'

author: Angel Carrow
text: 'Amazing food and great hospitality .. a must visit Indian joint'

author: Avirup Das
text: 'Amazing food and hospitality'

author: sat bhatia
text: 'Terrible experience. We ordered lot of food including two orders of panipuri . When the food came
column5: there was no pani for the pani pure. We called them back and explained. Very rude and then hung up. This is our first experience!'

author: madhuresh srivastav
text: 'Lots of great options with tasty twists. Try the naughty naan or Bun samosa.'

author: A P
text: 'Went for dinner... Good option for Indian American fusion food. very well flavored
column5: good taste.  Friendly staff and good ambience.'

author: Gibsonwedding0809 None
text: 'It was decent for fast Indian food. Naan was delicious'

author: Anuja Sawant
text: 'The food was amazing! My friends and I ended up ordering almost everything available on the menu and everything turned out to be great!\n\nThe service was great as well
column5:
very friendly and welcoming staff.

The sitting area features an interesting graffiti wall which improved the vibe of the place!

Overall a fun experience and highly recommend visiting it for amazing Indian food!'

author: Karan Acharekar
text: 'Amazing food. Super amazing desserts.'

author: Subhor Verma
text: 'Food here is amazing. Nice ambiance but music is always loud
column5: everytime i visit this place
column6:
i have to request them to lower the volume.

Try their Moong Dal Halwa and samosa

Edit: I had to reduce down their ratings. They take forever to serve. I have visited this places atleast 5+ times and everytime they had taken atleast 30 mins to get the food ready'

author: Resh K
text: "Yummmmm. It was a great and filling lunch. Indian flavours are there. But it isn't spicy. Wish they had spicy food. A little on the pricy side but I like how there is a variety of dishes in 1 meal. That's how it usually is in asia which I have been looking for."

author: Sangmi Kim
text: 'Delicuous!'

author: Matthew Recko
text: 'Staff was cheerful and quickly took care of my order. More importantly the food was fresh and flavorful. Ordered the fancy fries with lamb and wasn’t disappointed.'

author: Ruth Lema
text: 'Courteous
column5: quick service but the food tastes homemade! Made with lots of flavor and handsome portions! The house made drinks are refreshing but not too sweet. Highly recommend the bowls and the kulcha nana. Coming back again and again!'

author: Rich Santiago
text: 'Amazing! Not one complaint. I took my order to go and 45 mins later still hot. Still very tasty!!! Spicy and very authentic spices'

author: Ash P
text: 'Great food
column5: love the pani puri ans sexy fries. A must go spot for Indian street food.'

author: Rosie
text: 'I love this place. I’ve been here twice and on both occasions
column5: the service was excellent
column6: the food delicious. I love Indian food and this does not disappoint- a really cool combo of street food and authentic Indian cuisine. I highly recommend the tandoori burger... never had anything like it- so flavourful and crispy. These sweet potato fries are perfect. Not oily but super crispy! Can’t wait to come here again and try other items on the menu.'

author: Jeremy Engel
text: 'Such a great restaurant in Jersey area. I come here frequently as they have great prices for large portions of food. So tasty and reliable
column5: fast delivery and wonderful place to sit down with friends and family. Highly recommend!'

author: John Engelbach
text: 'Food was very good! Staff was extremely friendly and gave recommendations. Large portions for the price!'

author: Mohammad Islam
text: 'Food that hit the spot!'

author: Mars Lopez
text: 'Honestly best vegan burrito I’ve ever had! The flavor and spices were absolutely amazing. And the service was great. The staff and restaurant owner are also very friendly. My husband
column5: friends and I will definitely be ordering from here again when we’re in the area.'

author: Mohnish Manghnani
text: 'Curry Up Now was a great place for Indian food
column5: despite New Jersey having an abundance of options. The staff is very friendly
column6: and the manager
column7: Safwat was very warm and considerate. We got quick service and really tasty food. It’s a must try.'

author: Ranu Chatterjee
text: 'This is a perfect place for your snacking and catching up with friends. The food is delicious and the management is very friendly and welcoming. Highly recommended!'

author: JAY-S
text: 'Very  delicious food and the hospitality was amazing by safwat he went above and beyond he even gave my little daughter snacks and cookies on the house very recommended to go there'

author: Jalynn Steele
text: 'Good food
column5: get the samosas! Stopped by this place and the guy working there was fast and very friendly.'

author: Shweta Garg
text: 'So freaking good!! We got chicken makhani burrito
column5: naughty naan
column6: and the tandoori fried chicken sandwich and they were all beyond incredible!!! The chicken sandwich is so spicy but WOW the flavors!!!!! Highly recommend!!! Thank you to Safwat for being so helpful☺️☺️'

author: Jimmy Metwaly
text: 'Good food & good service
column5: nice people'

author: Vignesh M
text: 'Great taste. Food is always hot and usually good quality even while delivery takes 30 mins. Their app is however not good. I ordered via app and I got a different dish than ordered. Would recommend not order via their app.'

author: himo bajramovic
text: 'Food was delicious and the brother working up front made you feel more than welcome!! He showed me the menu and explained every single dish to me and gave me samples to make sure I liked it.His name is safwad  if he’s working up front I’m 110% you will leave with a smile.'

author: Bony Parikh
text: 'Great food! Tasty! Safar is a good attendant!'

author: Annu Dahiya
column5: 'Food was really fresh and innovative—a new contemporary take on Indian classics. The Vada Pav was really crispy and delicious in all the right ways. The deconstructed samosa was also very tasty as well.\n\nAlso the gulab jamun was the best I’ve ever had [nice springy texture
column6: not overly sweet
column7: slivered almonds added for texture in the syrup]
column8: and that’s coming from someone whose favorite childhood dessert was gulab jamun.\n\nWill be returning!'

author: Zaid Marji
text: 'Fantastic food I would even say better than the original cart in SF'

author: Nishank Varshney
text: 'Absolutely loved the food here! We ordered many chaat and Thali items including the Kachori Chat
column5: Paladin Chat
column6: Pav and Thalia
column7: and each and everything was amazing! I would totally recommend the Kachori Chat. Safwat was kind enough to exchange our non-veg dish from the Thali for Paneer. Also loved the ambience of this place! Will definitely come here again.'

author: Bhargava V
text: 'The tikka masala bowl is so good! And their kathi rolls are the best. Thank you for bringing us such tasty and creative combinations of indian food.'

author: Allison Van Roosen
text: 'Such an amazing experience! Very cozy spot
column5: and the food is super flavorful and awesome. Saawad
column6: the GM took care of us and couldn’t be nicer. 10/10 coming back!'

author: Ramses Torres
text: 'Love this place! The portions are filling and the prices are very reasonable. Also we were treated to deserts as a compliment. Would definitely recommend! Sawwad took care of us!!!'

author: walter dirkin
text: "The people that work there were very friendly and helpful. We had the chicken tikka burrito and It was very tasty. We'll be back!"

author: Bal Athwal
text: 'Food was much better second time around.  Deconstructive Samosa was the highlight.  DEATH BY TIKKA MASALA /w chicken was very good. Poor layout in the floor design
column5: they kept going back and forth between front prep area and kitchen in the back. very distracting if you are sitting.'

author: Paramesh Kumar
text: 'Chat was good thali was not at all gud'

author: rajkumar PARDASANI
text: 'Good unique fusion Indian dishes.'

author: Prathipati Karthikeya
text: 'Best THALI ever:)'

author: Anmol Kumar
text: 'Super yummy food
column5: very creative menu. Just a tad bit expensive.'

author: rohan kadu
text: 'Amazing food
column5: Friendly service and easy on the wallet. This place is highly recommended for people in Hoboken.'

author: Akshay Arora
text: "Highly recommended place for a quick bite of Indian food. The Paneer Naan was too delicious and the Mango Lassi was the perfect complement to it.\nGreat service and very nice staff.. The ambience is cozy and the prices are affordable'ish.\nDo check it out.. 🌟"

author: Amanda Brimat
text: "I order from Curry Up Now when I need a delicious Indian fix. The food is VERY tasty & filling. I've tried a lot of items on their menu including their Punjabi By Nature bowl
column5: Kathi Roll
column6: Sexy Fries
column7: & the new Tandoori Fried Chicken Sandwich. I recommend trying this place
column8: whether you're into Indian food or new to exploring it."

author: L O
text: 'This place is great!!! I have been been here many times now and there is quick professional service every time!!! Everything I get tastes great
column5: I especially love the Tandoori Fried Chicken Sandwich!!!\n\nThis place never disappoints!!! It’s my go to for Indian food ❤️❤️❤️'

author: Kelly French
text: 'The food is sooo yummy! My sister and I got the tikka masala bowl and the cheese ravioli. Both very good. Great friendly service.'

author: Melissa McGuirl
text: 'Quick service
column5: AMAZING food
column6: and unbeatable prices. Food is creative and unique
column7: yet authentic.'

author: Muzamil Ahmed
text: 'not good'

author: Pavel Garcia
text: 'First time trying it! And I gotta say that Vegan Plant Protein Bowl was amazing!!!! 🤤'

author: Purnima Dobriyal
text: 'Worst food actually...lots of salt and oil and no taste....it was not worth the money at all.....there are plenty of other Indian restaurants who serves authentic indian food. I won’t order from here again for sure'

author: T. Pisani
text: "I like the food here but I have two complaints. First
column5: TURN THE MUSIC DOWN! Every time I go there i'm shouting back and forth at the counter and with neither of us able to understand what the other is saying. It's obnoxious and I never know if my order is going to be correct.\nSecond
column6: they had signs up saying free naan bits of you fill out a survey online. I did that and then when I go to redeem the coupon they tell me they don't serve that there. Why was the sign in your shop?? They didn't offer me anything else as a replacement either. Bad customer service. These are minor complaints and it won't keep me from coming back but they are worth mentioning."

author: David Rosensaft
text: 'Quite tasty main dishes.  A little pricey for a fast food experience but not outrageously so.'

author: Berkay Koyun
text: 'Food was delicious'

author: JP Bevins
text: 'So good!!!!!!!\n\nOne of my favorite vegan options is the hella vegan burrito
column5: and it’s so damn good. Somosa burritos 🤤🤤🤤'

author: Ari Mukherjee
text: 'Order the papri chat and kathi roll via google and Postmates. First of all food was not ready on time and i was asked to wait 5 mins
column5: which is really tough in that stretch of Hoboken if you have a car with blinkers on. The papri chat was decent but was somewhat less in quantity compared to the price charged. I was expecting more. Kathi roll quantity was full filling but it was not a kathi roll but was some tikka masala burrito - if you want to have a kathi roll go to Kathi roll company in the city.'

author: Abby Washuta
text: "Don't let the chain-y look of the place fool you
column5: it's totally delicious and legit."

author: Rachel Bennett
text: 'Delicious food and the staff was so very friendly. Definitely would go again!'

author: Aleea Dugstad
text: 'Great food and good service! Lots of vegan options.'

author: ABOOZER A
text: 'Safwad was very kind and hospitable. Food was great. Highly recommended'

author: Ananda Sen Gupta
text: 'The food is quite flavorful- tried the paneer and chana masala combo and it tasted great'

author: Praneeta Lakkapragada
text: "A great spot for Indian street food. The samosas are the best. The mango lassi is delicious too
column5: you don't get any artificial flavour. Everything we ordered tasted good. The pricing is fair and the service is good. The best part paper straws and no plastic cutlery :)"

author: Kritika Singh
text: "We ordered vada pav
column5: deconstructed samosa
column6: kachori chat
column7: paneer kathi roll
column8: chicken burrito  and I would say there wasn't even a single dish that I got disappointed with. Great food with an amazing quality and best customer service. We ordered moong dal halwa for dessert and it's safe to say that it's pretty much the best moong dal halwa I have ever had. The staff was very caring & friendly and made sure we are satisfied with our food. We were served complimentary gulab jamuns in the end and a cute lil note from the chef himself😊. One of the best Indian street food in the NJ area .I would recommend this place 110%
column9: please try it and you are not gonna regret it."

author: James Burns
text: "What a great place. Superb contemporary fast-casual Indian dishes
column5: well priced and are clearly driven to deliver great customer service. I'll be back for more Team Curry Up!:)"

author: Eman Farag
text: 'Great place and great service. The kitchen manager was so friendly and he helped us to pick up whatever choice we want so patiently and let us even taste everything before ordering. He made sure that we get everything we want.  The food was so fresh and tasty. Will definitely come back to taste different  Indian flavors !'

author: Anya Ahuja
text: 'Ordered a vegan meal and got chicken. VERY disappointed'

author: Liang Kelly
text: "Five stars food
column5: five stars service. It is perfect to have some desserts on Chinese Valentine's Day. Wow🤩"

author: Arun Kalupahana
text: 'I walked In today to Check out the menu and possibly order something when i noticed a worker didn’t have his mask on properly it was below his nose i just Walked out. If your working in a Restaurant your mouth and nose should be covered during this pandemic especially if your working with food. I wont Be going back'

author: Ravikanth Pamidimukkala
text: 'Very authentic food!! Reminded me of India
column5: and great service! Best samosas I had in the US :)'

author: Kentarou Tamura
text: 'Got the Paneer Tikka Masala Burrito.  It was hearty and flavored well.  Suggest for a different bite.  Friendly staff.'

author: Tejal
text: 'worst customer service
column5: horrible staff does not value customer at all.'

author: Simranjit Singh
text: 'Thank you so much girls for your service. U are amazing.   Delicious food and friendly staff'

author: David Kotler
text: 'Came here tonight to pick up a takeout order. Upon entering I saw three employees - one was not wearing a mask at all
column5: the other two were but they weren’t even close to covering their nose. I felt very uncomfortable and canceled my order and left. Unacceptable!'

author: Sunil T
text: 'Amazing food.. tried their chicken tikka masala burrito and bowl
column5: both were amazing!'

author: Unego Yao
text: 'Very Good!'

author: akshay chavan
text: 'Visited today
column5: and just loved the taste
column6: had chicken and paneer kati roll along with dahi puri and the taste was just amazing.. i will try few more dishes next time
column7: keep up the good work.. cheers.'

author: Maya Abukhamireh
text: 'We are visiting from Wisconsin and wanted to grab a bite to eat before we stop at Carlos.  The food was amazing
column5: we sat outside and the atmosphere was very peaceful.  They gave us complimentary sweets (gulab juman)and it was delicious. If you want delicious Indian street food this is the place.'

author: Linda Lou Kettleman
text: 'Foodis good but the atmosphere caters to 18 to 21. Loud Rap music where every other word was a curse.being played. I left there with a headache. I had to have my two grandchildren wait outside.'

author: Amit Ganatra
text: 'Check the place out if you speak even a smattering  of Hindi
column5: it is witty. Tried the Punjabi by nature which is a grab bag of the standard classics.  I can imagine a lot of Indians not finding it spicy enough
column6: but I liked it a lot. Liked the price/portion trade off as well.'

author: Trina Monae
text: 'Curry Up Now in Hoboken is AMAZING. Such great fresh food and immaculate staff. Very clean and swift service
column5: without missing out on quality! 10/10 recommend if you are around. A nice shout out to Timothy who served us today.'

author: Milena Marylska
text: 'Best new place in Hoboken. Good vibe
column5: great food with unique menu items. The owner was very charming and gracious
column6: the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Definitely a must!'

author: Astroboy_clipz
text: 'Tikka masala bowl with the homemade mango lassi was spectacular. The gulab jamun did the final trick. Coming soon again'

author: Keith Kelleher
text:
'Ordered online and at pick up the three staff wear not wearing face covers.

Confronted them and they said they had them but didn’t need them because of the heat in the kitchen.

I had some choice words for the gentleman I spoke with that he found offensive but yet had to answer for conducting food prep without face coverings.'

author: Dhruv Patel
text: 'Very expensive
column5:
Very poor quality of food.
Missed few items in delivery order.
Wouldn’t order again ever.
Paid $60 and did not like anything at all.'

author: Sneha Maun
text: 'The food is not at all at par. Ordered Vada Pav and it was re-fried more than 2 times at-least. The paneer was very oily. The Naan was really nice though. Ordered first time and was not impressed at all. May be they are exhausted with high number of orders.'

author: Brittany Crutcher
text: 'This food was so delicious...great vegan options lost to choose from on the menu.'

author: Emily Y.
text: "I've been to their California locations so I was super excited to see them open here. Great food just like in California except service was 500% even better. One of the ladies was really sweet and made sure we had anything we needed."

author: Shruthi Ramesh
text: 'Took tip unnecessarily for Take out order. Quality of tea was below average.'

author: Dhara Patel
text: 'The food from Curry Up Now was delicious! I loved the paneer tikka masala burrito and the lamb keema bowl! The quality on how they cooked the lamb was excellent! The presentation and vibe of the restaurant are super cute and have a very pleasant aesthetic. The staff is courteous and attentive. It was a great experience and totally recommend going!'

author: nishi lawren
text:
'Amazing food. Walking distance from the station. A welcome surprise in the heart of Hoboken

Love the Naan bites and Naughty Naan. The thali is also so filling. Friendly staff.

Would love to go there more frequently'

author: Ginette B
text: 'Lamb was off the charts and the food is affordable. Chickpeas were very well seasoned and I enjoyed the portions'

author: Arbriel Tucker
text: 'A unique fast food Indian spot! Located in the heart of Hoboken. The food was amazing and different than what I am use to. I will be back to get more! The sexy fries are my absolute favorite.'

author: Edward Macharia
text: 'Great Indian food in a clean
column5: inviting environment. The staff was awesome. I will definitely be back.'

author: Priyambada Jain
text: 'Curry up now is a place that serves Indian food with a twist. When it comes to giving a twist that too to one of the most difficult cuisine which involves a span of different spices and it can be challenging to attain the perfect balance of the various ingredients.\n\nThis place provides a eclectic menu with dishes that will excite you and will be different from the ones that you have in mind when it comes to Indian food. I stumbled upon this location during their soft launch phase and ordered some of the must try dishes from their menu like Holy moly fried ravioli
column5:
Naughty Naan and Mumbai dahi Puri.

Ravioli and Naan were good needed a little bit more flavours and seasoning. The little bit disappointing factor was the chat dahi Puri this is such a vibrant dish but it lacked the basic chutneys which are soul of the chat and another point being the potato inside were diced without any seasoning added and not mashed. The potato felt raw and tasteless and the whole chat experience was missing from it. .

I am still interested in coming back to the place to try the other dishes and hoping the chat improves the next time.'

author: J-Rocks!
text: "Delicious restaurant quality Indian food
column5: hospitable and charming staff
column6: clean
column7: trendy decor.\nI chose from the 'Lite' section of the menu
column8: it was fresh with a homemade taste
column9: ideal for lunch without putting me in an afternoon food coma.\nNice to see an establishment not using single-use plastics for dining in 👍"

author: Sahil Ramchandani
text:
"This place is fire. Not sure what some of the bad reviews are about but I've had this twice now (Delivery and Pickup). I didn't love every dish I had but I can say confidently every dish I had the quality of ingredients is evident.

Papdi Chaat: Amazing. Great Indian snack that they assemble perfectly.

Holy Moly Fried Ravioli: They forgot the Tikka Masala dip but I tasted the potential in the plain Ravioli. With the dip
column5:
I know this would be a winner.

Deconstructed Samosa: Perfect app to share. Samosa is super tasty and all the chutneys and Chana Masala blend really well together. It's pieced together perfectly.

Naughty Naan Paneer: Not the favorite of the order but still not mad we split it. A lot of the group was saying it had too much of one flavor. Maybe cardamon?

Quesadillix: Everyone got this as their entree and loved it. From Chicken
column6: Lamb
column7: Paneer
column8: and Aloo every protein choice got raving reviews. Now this is super oily and butter as it is a Parantha so has to be loaded with Ghee (Indian butter) but once you get past that WOW it's delicious. The dipping yogurt and chutney is the perfect pair to complete it
column9: one aspect I thought the Burrito was missing.\n\nBurrito: I got the Chicken Burrito. I felt like this lacked a certain flavor that would've completed it. It's basically Chicken Tikka Masala
column11: and Rice. While each tasted good individually
column12: it didn't blend well together. Maybe it's just missing the yogurt and chutney that the Quesadillix has.\n\nI know this is going to be a go to spot for me. Try it out for yourself!"

author: Luis Farfan
text:
'(Translated by Google) Perfect and rich food good attention

(Original)
Perfecta y rica comida buena atención'

author: Anukrati Khare
text: 'Good service. Good food.\nOwner served us some complimentary drinks.'

author: Marley Kimelman
text: 'Awesome food and such nice staff! If you’re looking for a quick and delicious bite to eat this is your place.'

author: Billy Lemire
text:
'New to Indian street food so sampled a lil everything.

App was the normal cheese ravioli but with Tikko masala dip. Awesome!

Burrito was GHEE MAKHNI BUTTER chicken w/ butter masala. Another Awesome dish.

THALI Meat Sweats. Ground Lamb (lil spicy). Makhachkala Butter Chicken enough for one if your hungry. Another awesome dish.

Overall great experience will defiantly share and return again.'

author: Ozzy Guzman
text: 'Prepare your mouth to be revived and your stomach satisfied!  Absolutely delicious food and refreshing drinks!'

author: Steph Anie
text: 'Such a dope vibes! Nice colorful little spot Walked in and instantly felt welcomed owner took our ordered we have a peanut allergy and he guided us to food we could choose from. Everyone was so nice
column5: food was made and brought out in a timely fashion. Recommended for sure! Would go back again!'

author: Omarsam Sam
text: 'food was good and Jada gave an excelente customer service'

author: Abhinandan Choudhary
text: 'Good and unique food. Really like this place:'

author: Richika Saraf
text: 'Nice ambience and 4 stars for the effort to try innovative Indian dishes which is very much required in US since very few people innovate and create fusion food styles. However the quality of paneer used was not great. Gave the same review to the restaurant manager and he took it positively. The dish we liked the most was quesadilix with potato.'

author: Stuart Lester
text: 'Lamb curry was great.  Staff is very helpful in deciding the best options
column5: and listens to you'

author: Kris H
text: 'Great food
column5: but you must be able to deal with mild to high heat!!🌶 (tika masala and lamb burritos are the best!!)'

author: sarita shinde
text: 'The place has a nice vibe to it. Keema pav was really nice but the chaat was below average.\n\nI would give it another go and try one of the thalis.'

author: Alexander Gee
text: 'As a San Francisco transplant
column5: the one thing I missed about SF was curry up now. So happy to have this option on east coast speed dial.'

author: omar are
text: 'Very nice place!!. Food is Very good'

author: Ashish Tambadkar
text: 'Indian food in Hoboken
column5: Curry Up now is the place to definitely visit. Staff is super friendly and their food tastes amazing !'

author: Eric S
text: "Food was great
column5: interesting concept with lots of  vegetarian options. Lost one star because both times we've gone
column6: our food was delivered to the wrong table leading to exceptional wait times
column7: and having to remind the cashier what we ordered. Since the other tables' dishes were effectively comped
column8: having to prepare the same dish twice will also eat into the company's profits."

author: S B
text: "Ordered a Paneer Kati roll and Chai. Did not like both. Chai was all milk no taste neither flavor and Kati roll was just saag paneer in a bread rolled up. Also the place is kinda pricy but I guess it's Hoboken :("

author: bala murty
text: 'Excellent spot! Highly recommend it.'

author: tarun bansal
text: 'All the items in menu are really good but the bun samosa really stands out. Must eat!'

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Decent Indian food with very friendly service. I should have gone with the regular rice instead of the riced cauliflower since the chicken tikka masala bowl was pretty soupy/saucy.'

author: Sachin Patrick
text:
'(Translated by Google) Go to pav? Do you have a burger?

(Original)
Vada pav? Vada hamburger??'

author: Darshan Vithlani
text: "Deserves a 5 star rating. Ambiance is amazing & so is the food. One gets a choice of authentic Indian food as well as Indian fusion. Won't regret dining here."

author: Dan Ostrach
text: 'Interesting and eclectic menu
column5: with excellent flavors to match the selection. The staff was friendly
column6: the restaurant was clean
column7: and the high chairs were available and in great shape (probably not important to most of you
column9: it is!). Also probably amazing for late night. Definitely will be back.'

author: Burty Macwan
text:
'A unique jewel in the heart of Hoboken
Food is an Americanized version of Indian Street food.
Staff is very Friendly and do their best to make your experience as worthwhile as possible
Chai is good. Quesadillix and sexy Fries are really good.'

author: Diego Henriquez
text: 'Great food great tastes workers were great and suggestive. Will come back everytime Im craving Indian cuisine and they are also open late which is awsome I went on a weekend and they were still open until 4 am'

author: Daniel Fogal
text: 'Tasty
column5: creative food and friendly service.'

author: khush patel
text: 'Please dont waste your time and money if you looking for authentic Indian food. High price with no quality. They tried to give americanized names to menu to attract large population but no quality.\nFood is not fresh and taste like any other ordinary place. Nothing special about the taste. I will not come again. If you really hungry do not rely on their food.'

author: H P
text: 'There are so many options to choose from
column5: especially their vegetarian and vegan options! I ordered their sexy fries with paneer
column6: I have to say it was on point and lived up to its name! Their quesadillix is just as good
column7: very filling. Staff is very friendly and quick service.'

author: Badam P
text: 'Very fast service. Food was very tasteful. Lots of options to pick from for veg. and non-veg. Will definitely go again!'

author: Manthan Patel
text: 'Food was amazing..."Deconstructed Samosa" was on point!! Definitely recommend trying them out. You won\'t be disappointed..'

author: rohit kapa
text: 'Disappointed
column5: not the same like one in San Francisco where it all started.'

author: Scott Wisotsky
text: 'First off
column5: ordering in their machine was just odd. It was much more complicated than it needed to be. Mango lassi was good
column6: but hella vegan.... it was just bad. The rice just tasted very bland
column7: and the spices did not mix well together. I really would not recommend. The main plus side is that the restaurant was very clean
column8: and the staff were very warm and friendly'

author: Cameron Lancaster
text: 'Pretty solid food with quick service and friendly staff'

author: Jigar Patel
text: 'Good fast casual Indian food. The hot sauce was on point. I will be back to try more items on menu.'

author: Vishal S
text: 'Very disappointing visit overall.\n\nFriendly and hardworking staff
column5: somewhat nice
column6: clean ambience.\n\nWeird recipe of dishes
column7: no I am not complaining about it to be much Americanized version but weird ingredient. Methi Rice
column8: Kadahi chicken with oily gravy (capsicum flavored)
column9: Yellow daal mix of soya beens
column10:
Frozen Naans.

For heaven sake don’t attach the name Punjabi to it. May be UP or Bihar food.

Marketed as street food priced at dine in standards.

Ahh just another placeholder in Hoboken.'

author: Vicky Song
text: 'This review is really disappointing to write because I was really excited about this place openning up on Hoboken. Pretty expensive for really small portion sizes and watery curry. What bothers me the most is that they are inconsistently …'

author: anthony flora
text: 'Every single dish on the menu is delish\n\nI love the authentic style of ingredients that they put into the food they use real ingredients delicious will be going back most likely today'

author: Kunal Mathur
text: "Recently visited this place during it's soft open phase.. conveniently located on Washington St near CVS. Tried the samosas
column5: chicken kaati roll and the Kapoor & Sons thali... Loved them all... Looking forward to the launch day to visit again!"
